net.majorkernelpanic.streaming

Class Session

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.majorkernelpanic.streaming.Session

  • public class Session
extends java.lang.Object
    You should instantiate this class with the SessionBuilder.
    This is the class you will want to use to stream audio and or video to some peer using RTP.
    It holds a VideoStream and a AudioStream together and provides synchronous and asynchronous functions to start and stop those steams. You should implement a callback interface Session.Callback to receive notifications and error reports.
    If you want to stream to a RTSP server, you will need an instance of this class and hand it to a RtspClient. If you don't use the RTSP protocol, you will still need to send a session description to the receiver for him to be able to decode your audio/video streams. You can obtain this session description by calling configure() or syncConfigure() to configure the session with its parameters (audio samplingrate, video resolution) and then getSessionDescription().
    See the example 2 here: https://github.com/fyhertz/libstreaming-examples to see an example of how to get a SDP.
    See the example 3 here: https://github.com/fyhertz/libstreaming-examples to see an example of how to stream to a RTSP server.

      static interface  Session.Callback
      The callback interface you need to implement to get some feedback Those will be called from the UI thread.

      • ERROR_STORAGE_NOT_READY

        public static final int ERROR_STORAGE_NOT_READY
        The internal storage of the phone is not ready. libstreaming tried to store a test file on the sdcard but couldn't. See H264Stream and AACStream to find out why libstreaming would want to something like that.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ERROR_UNKNOWN_HOST

        public static final int ERROR_UNKNOWN_HOST
        The destination set with setDestination(String) could not be resolved. May mean that the phone has no access to the internet, or that the DNS server could not resolved the host name.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        The origin address of the session. It appears in the session description.
        Parameters:
        origin - The origin address

      • setDestination

        public void setDestination(java.lang.String destination)
        The destination address for all the streams of the session.
        Changes will be taken into account the next time you start the session.
        Parameters:
        destination - The destination address

      • setTimeToLive

        public void setTimeToLive(int ttl)
        Set the TTL of all packets sent during the session.
        Changes will be taken into account the next time you start the session.
        Parameters:
        ttl - The Time To Live

      • setVideoQuality

        public void setVideoQuality(VideoQuality quality)
        Sets the configuration of the stream.
        You can call this method at any time and changes will take effect next time you call configure().
        Parameters:
        quality - Quality of the stream

      • setSurfaceView

        public void setSurfaceView(SurfaceView view)
        Sets a Surface to show a preview of recorded media (video).
        You can call this method at any time and changes will take effect next time you call start() or startPreview().

      • setPreviewOrientation

        Sets the orientation of the preview.
        You can call this method at any time and changes will take effect next time you call configure().
        Parameters:
        orientation - The orientation of the preview

        public java.lang.String getSessionDescription()

        Returns:
        The Session Description.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown when setDestination(String) has never been called.

      • syncConfigure

        public void syncConfigure()
                   throws CameraInUseException,
                          StorageUnavailableException,
                          ConfNotSupportedException,
                          InvalidSurfaceException,
                          java.lang.RuntimeException,
                          java.io.IOException
        Does the same thing as configure(), but in a synchronous manner.
        Throws exceptions in addition to calling a callback Session.Callback.onSessionError(int, int, Exception) when an error occurs.
        Throws:
        CameraInUseException
        StorageUnavailableException
        ConfNotSupportedException
        InvalidSurfaceException
        java.lang.RuntimeException
        java.io.IOException

        Asynchronously starts all streams of the session.

               throws CameraInUseException,
                      StorageUnavailableException,
                      ConfNotSupportedException,
                      InvalidSurfaceException,
                      java.net.UnknownHostException,
                      java.io.IOException
        Starts a stream in a synchronous manner.
        Throws exceptions in addition to calling a callback.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the stream to start
        Throws:
        CameraInUseException
        StorageUnavailableException
        ConfNotSupportedException

        java.net.UnknownHostException

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops all existing streams.

      • syncStop

        public void syncStop()
        Stops all existing streams in a synchronous manner.

      • startPreview

        public void startPreview()
        Asynchronously starts the camera preview.
        You should of course pass a SurfaceView to setSurfaceView(SurfaceView) before calling this method. Otherwise, the Session.Callback.onSessionError(int, int, Exception) callback will be called with ERROR_INVALID_SURFACE.

      • stopPreview

        public void stopPreview()
        Asynchronously stops the camera preview.

      • switchCamera

        public void switchCamera()
        Switch between the front facing and the back facing camera of the phone.
        If startPreview() has been called, the preview will be briefly interrupted.
        If start() has been called, the stream will be briefly interrupted.
        To find out which camera is currently selected, use getCamera()

      • getCamera

        public int getCamera()
        Returns the id of the camera currently selected.
        It can be either CameraInfo#CAMERA_FACING_BACK or CameraInfo#CAMERA_FACING_FRONT.

      • toggleFlash

        public void toggleFlash()
        Toggles the LED of the phone if it has one. You can get the current state of the flash with getVideoTrack() and VideoStream.getFlashState().

      • release

        public void release()
        Deletes all existing tracks & release associated resources.

      • trackExists

        public boolean trackExists(int id)

      • getTrack

        public Stream getTrack(int id)
